website_summaries.verdict: This router makes it easy for multiple people to stream video and move large amounts of data on the same network.
pros: Dual-band connectivity ensures a solid connection
Designed to support an office space’s essential networking needs

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, buy a better one to begin with.
customer_reviews.text: Worked OK for a while, but connectivity became questionable. Our Bose Soundtouch would stop playing, and download speeds shown on speedtest.net were down by 50%. Cell phones (Galaxy S7's) would have a difficult time connecting. Streaming video from Amazon or Netflix became tedious. Gave up on this one and bought a higher end access point which so far has performed flawlessly at much better throughput.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Gasaway

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate product info
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because the product description claims it's a "Standalone Access Point with mesh, client, and AP modes..." That's not at all true. It is completely incapable of client mode, so I can't use this to get a wired device onto my wireless network. This is extremely frustrating. Beyond that, the UI is pretty terrible. It feels like Netgear hasn't upgraded their interface in a decade, and in fact I remember their other products having slightly better UIs. So this is a step backwards. Anyway, I can't say if this is a good product for what I want it, but on the grounds of it not living up to the promise of the product description, I'm panning it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M

customer_reviews.title: Works great since Zoom classes started
customer_reviews.text: With 5 people using Zoom and other video conferencing apps in the house at the same time I had to increase total WiFi bandwidth. I ran two ethernet cables from the primary router in the middle of our home to connect to NETGEAR AC1200s at opposite sides of the house. Not difficult to setup. Good range. Great WiFi distribution across our house and to the front/back yards as well. WiFi range outside reaches out to 150 feet! Really good home solution and beats having to buy enterprise level hardware. Our primary WiFi router is a Frontier/Verizon FIOS G1100.
customer_reviews.author: Dan - Managed Property Services

customer_reviews.title: I dont know how it works
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how it works because I haven't been able to get it to connect. Instructions are terrible and very confusing. Ethernet connection is not available (only coax) so I must connect to the router via wifi. I get a 12mbps signal at the access point (it is typically over 100 mbps at the router) but I can not connect neither by entering router address nor by wps method. I have not found a contact number for tech support so I am dead in the water. I can see the access point in my available networks and can connect to it but I do not have internet access. I suppose I'll try again later.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Doerr

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to expand home wifi
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I've moved in, I've always had trouble receiving a stable and reliable wifi signal in my room. It has been this way for several years now and recently a friend told me about AP's or Access Point. Skeptical, I did a bit of research and found this one on sale. Setup was really easy, I ran an Ethernet cable from my router to this AP and a bit of setup later, I had a reliable connection comparable to the signal I had if I were right next to the router. Moral of story: don't use an extender, use an Access Point!
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!! Best purchase of 2019!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this thing 100 stars ⭐️ 🌟 🌟⭐️🌟⭐️🌟⭐️🌟🌟 💫 💫💫💫💫💫💫 I would!!!! This thing has my entire house running 200mbps (that is the max of my service) prior to this I was getting 200 in the office and everywhere else <50 MBps! every corner of my house is blazing fast I’m getting 190mbps while running aVPN!!!!!!!! On all my devices my iPhone my laptop my firetv 4ks All I did was plug it into a outlet I previously installed in the living room, that is really a 100’ lan line that runs from the modem router combo into the attic in the office and down through the wall in the living room plugged it in and viola!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Decent Low Cost Access Point with Ridiculous Setup Software
customer_reviews.text: For the life of me, could not get the wired Ethernet set up interface to work. I have never used a wireless access point or router where couldn't connect directly to the unit. Kind of a joke. Multiple resets and frustration. Wireless setup was lengthy and frustrating. To secure this thing, you change the password. Then go through the whole process of reconnecting - not as easy as you would think. Then you attempt to change the SSID and passphrases. Then go through the whole process again of connecting. Changing the wireless computer's configuration to connect. After re-configuring your computers wireless setting, you can now connect again to check or change your settings. It took longer than it should have.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Support the only issue. Excellent equipment.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this at least a 4 star but their help is non existent and their site for getting the necessary software to make the necessary setup inputs was down for hours and from what I saw when observing the comments this was a frequent problem. The equipment is a good piece of equipment and it functions with no problems. It has been reliable with absolutely no issues since original installation. The software actually required very little changes to the preprogrammed software. My complaint is a frequent lack of support and availability of the setup software.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this access point to replace an old unit that died. I wasted three hours of my life trying to set up this new unit. None of the setup instructions worked. None of the IP addresses work. None of the password information works. The instructions refer to an 'access point label' on the access point that isn't there. There is no human tech support. All the support pages lead you in circles. A horrible experience for something that should be simple.
customer_reviews.author: Buford S Wright

customer_reviews.title: "Bridge Mode" Cannot act as a WIFI to LAN Bridge, only as a WIFI repeater.
customer_reviews.text: Just a warning to folks looking to use this as a WIFI to LAN bridge. In bridge mode it only support WIFI repeater, and on a single channel. No dual-mode speeds. The on-board LAN ports do not work with this mode.
customer_reviews.author: ZapD

customer_reviews.title: GOOD WIFI NOT USER FRIENDLY PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This product is not user friendly and the support is terrible like all the Netgear products, but I had to admit this is one of the few good working products from Netgear, I have six of these units connected to my ubiquiti edgerouter x that is a low price high performance router(not user friendly) replacing the Netgear nighthawk X10 that is a terrible router, after having the Netgear nighthawk X10 I was afraid of trying more Netgear products but this units are good and dependable but as I mentioned before NOT USER FRIENDLY.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERTO VILLEGAS

customer_reviews.title: Died after 48 hours, not great before that.
customer_reviews.text: The biggest problem with this is that it died completely after 48 hours. No wifi, no lights. Unplug and replug and still nothing. Every product has some early death; perhaps I was unlucky but I had reservations before that. This is a pretty basic AP. It does not offer multiple SSIDs etc like my previous one did. For most people that is fine. The 5GHz channel of this AP worked fine with all the devices I tried it with. The 2.4 GHz channel did not. I had connection problems with a number of devices until I limited the 2.4GHz channel to 54Mb/s (basicly disabled N and AC modes). Those same devices worked fine with my previous N access point.
customer_reviews.author: William Mills

customer_reviews.title: I set up 4 of these at a house no problem
customer_reviews.text: I will admit I set up a lot of systems so maybe my experience helped me set up this Netgear WAP. I see where others have complained about the complexity of the setup. But I found it to be logical and no more complicated than any other professional device out there I have worked with. I have seen less impressive security and simpler setup menus on other devices as well, but I was not too confident I could do everything I wanted to with the simpler interfaces on these other devices. Bottom line, after setup these work great.
customer_reviews.author: Frank X

customer_reviews.title: Solved my basement signal problem
customer_reviews.text: It gives an equally strong signal in the basement once I ran the ethernet cable and set it up. I would have given it a 5 but the users manual needs some improvement. I had to go online after I could not get it to work. However, I eventually figured out myself that you needed to enter the passphrase and not the password for part of the setup process. once that was figured out it worked to perfection. So in terms of effectiveness it is a 5, but instructions could be clearer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi access point
customer_reviews.text: I found that connecting to it to set it up was tricky but I eventually got it done. I wanted to use this to reach another building about 100 yards away. It was positioned in a place that the signal could go through a window. The signal strength at the remote site is not very strong so I am disappointed about that. It would seem that with the dual antennas that the signal should be stronger. I could not find a place to set the RF power so I assume that it is always using full power. Perhaps I am expecting to much...
customer_reviews.author: Roy Gould

customer_reviews.title: Netgear AC1200 isnot the appliance you expect as access point
customer_reviews.text: NETGEAR AC1200 Dual Band Wireless Access Point is a transmitter rather than a wireless receiver access point. The manual which can be downloaded from Netgear is worthless. In order to get this device to work a user would have to connect it to a wired modem, router, or switch to receive Ethernet signals, then AC1200 function is to allow wireless devices to connect to it. It's not a wireless router. If the buyer is looking for a wireless receiver, this device will not work, however, if the buyer is looking for a wireless transmitter to act as an access point then get this.
customer_reviews.author: A. Earl Jackson III

customer_reviews.title: This gives the house network an extra boost
customer_reviews.text: One router that is somewhat centrally located reaches part of the house, but the rest had a weak signal, so this was set up and plugged into the network (wired) and does a nice job of covering the whole house. I have great neighbors who sometimes have trouble with their older wifi and in a pinch if they sit at their kitchen table can pick up my original wifi router, but this one gives them a stronger signal.
customer_reviews.author: A Close Reader

customer_reviews.title: Stops Communicating
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 of these, all 3 have the same hardware revision and firmware. one works just fine, no issues. The other 2 will just (randomly) stop sending/receiving data, they APPEAR to be active, but no throughput. They have to be power cycled before they will start working again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works well!
customer_reviews.text: We used this to extend an office wireless network and it was easy to implement and works very well. I would recommend it to others and use it again if needed. We attached this to an existing RJ45 connection and we use the extra ports coming off of it for the original device. If we need to extend the wireless range again perhaps we'll be able to do the same thing with another unit. Lots of value for the money. Our original plan was to use POE connections to this type of device. The result of trying the quick fix of this NETGEAR is we do not need to improve it now. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Vagabond Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not useful as a bridge unless you have another one
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use as a wifi bridge. Unlike every other device I've ever seen that allows bridging, this thing can only bridge with another Netgear. Replacing it with a TP-Link. And, the documentation is awful, took some online searching to find out that bridging wouldn't work.
customer_reviews.author: W. Ezell

customer_reviews.title: Its borderline Cr@p,  No ability to easily change security /password settings
customer_reviews.text: I wish i had read more reviews prior to purchase. I work in IT and I am appalled on how rinky dink this product is from this company. It works right out of the box if you dont mind having to use the default user name and password, changing that would not be enough as you would want to do some sort of MAC filtering on your home network. I would not recommend this for a business use as it leaves a backdoor open to your network.....dont walk away from this - RUN
customer_reviews.author: Zaphod Beeblebrox

customer_reviews.title: No Guest Network
customer_reviews.text: I cant believe that a modern company like Netgear would product a wireless access point device that is not able to have a guest network. So if I have guest come to my house & I want to allow them to hook up to the internet I have to give them open access to my network....NOT acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Hutch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Access Point (specially if you can get it on sale!!!)
customer_reviews.text: Just moved to a two story house (from a small condo). My old Netgear router was just barely covering the house. With at least one room upstairs having no WiFi at all (router is in the basement). Luckily the house has Cat 5 running upstairs. Plugged in the new AP upstairs and the entire house now has solid and fast WiFi. An added benefit is the old router is 2.4Ghz only, now I have 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz access. Best example of the difference is the wireless Roku stick. Before the new AP it said it was getting ~10 mbps (Roku is upstairs and old router is in the basement). Now it says ~50 mbps.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dodge

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and configure, up and running in 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: This item sold as a return from another customer, as such the price was less than half of a new, unopened package. Other than some missing documentation pages, the package had everything needed to install and use. The web user interface was simple and straight forward with default values for most commonly used features, making configuration so simple, anyone could do it. Between the ease of setup and the reduced price, this was an excellent bargain all around.
customer_reviews.author: R. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Easy to Mount, Excellent Performance, Mediocre Firmware
customer_reviews.text: The setup software is very average, but everything else on this product is top-notch and the performance is stellar. Depending on where I sit (my condo is the epicenter of a freeking WIFI signal storm) I get at least 100 and as high as 160Mbps data over the 5G WIFI signal. I setup my nest thermostat to connect via the lower bandwidth signal. Rock solid performance over connections that do not drop no matter where I sit inside the home. Very happy with this device.
customer_reviews.author: RumbaGuy

customer_reviews.title: WORST purchase I have ever made.
customer_reviews.text: It came with instructions yet I still haven't been able to get it connected correctly. I have called 3x and spoke to different people (who do not speak clear English not do they understand me, it's like they are reading from a script). WORST purchase I have ever made. It's now more then 24 hours, I emailed requesting assistance and no email back to help install it.
customer_reviews.author: SimplyB

customer_reviews.title: Fast speeds, good coverage, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why some of the reviews say it's hard to install: it's not. I just plugged it in, looked at my router to figure out what DHCP address it was given, then used that address to log in with a browser and set it up. Setup was easy, and speeds and coverage are fantastic. It's physically much larger than it needs to be (the box innards are about 80% empty space), but other than that, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Low End Access Point
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to supplement/replace the wifi from my ISP supplied box. So far so good. Much more reliable than my ISP's wifi. Both are dual-band AC, but I would often have issues requiring me to reboot the ISP's unit. I have yet to have to reboot this Netgear AP and have much better coverage. While there are better access points and wireless routers available on the market, this low-cost AP more than fits my needs. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for something better than the wifi provided by ISP supplied modem/routers, but don't want to buy expensive high-quality modem/routers or separate devices.
customer_reviews.author: Johnr9816

customer_reviews.title: Great for extending my network.
customer_reviews.text: Using it as an AP. Great signal. Solid connection. The only confusion I have is that on my main router, any device connected to this wirelessly appears as wired on my main router. I had the same setup before and those devices showed up as wireless devices. Not a big deal except for troubleshooting when I'm looking for a wireless device and it appears in the wired devices.
customer_reviews.author: Milton M Turnerhill

customer_reviews.title: Good solution at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: We moved to a new house and the router is at the opposite corner from the farthest room in the house, so WiFi signal was weak. Fortunately this is new construction and all the rooms are wired to a central wiring cabinet. By connecting the Cat5e cable for the distant room to the router, we now have a strong signal on that side of the house, plus three additional hard-wired port.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in CA

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: We got a netgear model wac104 on the advice of the technician that was wiring up the upstairs. We got it through Amazon and It worked for a few months. Then we had a power surge and needed to reset it to the internet but now we are being told that we needed to subscribe in order for it to work! Why should I have to subscribe to anything when I own the device?
customer_reviews.author: Jen Stoddard

customer_reviews.title: You Need TWO of these for a Wifi to Ethernet Bridge
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a Netgear N Wifi Bridge that captured the wifi signal and bridged it back to ethernet. I assumed that this was the AC version of that product. It is not. You need one in base station mode and another in wireless repeater mode to accomplish the wifi to ethernet bridge. This is not mentioned on the included instructions nor the longer manual i found on their website. I only found the information after googling and finding a forum post of someone trying to do the same thing, with a moderator response from Netgear saying you need 2 of these devices to perform the wifi ethernet bridge. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Foster

customer_reviews.title: A most excellent Access Point
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my old WiFi access point with a new, better model and this is a perfect choice! Dual band both 2.4 and 5 GhZ and has performed flawlessly. Easy setup and using my existing SSID's and PW's I didn't have to redo any of my home smart devices. Much MUCH better signal strength too!! I like this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Fred H.

customer_reviews.title: Ugh.....so frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Connects randomly, disconnects randomly, says PW is incorrect when it is correct. Has problem with Apple products, apparently. Wow, awesome, that's so useful. JUNK
customer_reviews.author: B. Sims

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi simple to install
customer_reviews.text: I’m not very tech savvy, but I was struggling with WiFi at the far end of the house. I tried a range extender and had very little luck when multiple devices were being used. I ran an Ethernet line through the attic and mounted the access point over the rooms that were questionable. It works very well so far. The only problem is sometimes when I’m closer to the router side of the house my device does not switch back to the original WiFi signal. Other than that I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Truck tech

customer_reviews.title: It put MALWARE on my Mac.  Beware
customer_reviews.text: This this is terrible. It wasn't easy to connect to and once I connected it it couldn't reach the internal website where you configure the settings. It gives you an IP number to connect to... which puts a Yahoo search redirect Malware on my Mac. You will have a very hard time getting rid of it. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED
customer_reviews.author: Bogeymaker451

customer_reviews.title: item is great
customer_reviews.text: I am. Netgear fans, my modem, routers, switch all Netgear. WAC104 is real good router but the list not accurate does not have bridge mode, so i bought the other Netgear router model WAC124 too which has the bridge mode , but both routers are great depends on your need
customer_reviews.author: Nash

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!! Set up website is gone!!!
customer_reviews.text: While setting this access point up the website aplogin.net went down ( 1/11/20 ) Apparently Netgear did not pay Network Solutions (webhost) for the domain name and were shut down. Can not set the unit up which makes product useless!!!
customer_reviews.author: James J. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an Apple Extreme that started having problems with this and several problems went away. I replaced and AP with a netgear AP at sametime and my problem with transitioning when moving from one end of the ouse with mobiles went away. Don't care for the mobile app much, so I use the browser interface. It works fine and is way faster than the old apple even on 2.4g. I would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Everything worked, except the WPS function
customer_reviews.text: I had to return it because it failed to connect with my panasonic stereo through the WPS function. Everything else worked. Unfortunately WPS was the only way to connect the stereo. After returning it I bought instead the TP-Link AC1200, and that one had no problem connecting with all my devices including the stereo. I am still giving it 3 stars because everything else worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Online Buyer

customer_reviews.title: False description and deceptive advertisin
customer_reviews.text: This is not a wireless access point. It is a wired access point. I purchased this product more than 30 days ago, and put it aside until I was ready for it, only to find out this is a WIRED ACCESS POINT that requires an ethernet cable to to connect to a network. I surmise that I need to check each device as soon as it arrives, and not to trust the description provided by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Mcdougall

customer_reviews.title: Much improved user interface
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an decade old access point finding the user interface to greatly improved. I do wish the signal strength was stronger, or perhaps it is the antennas about which there is no information. But still, a low cost easy to use device for extending wifi coverage within the home.
customer_reviews.author: Solar_K

customer_reviews.title: Can be set up w/ 2 different names
customer_reviews.text: You may need a geek to help you, though probably not. Great signal from this Access Point, and it offers two wireless connections - a 5g one and a slower speed (don't remember the numbers) one. You don't even have to bother with the slower one, but as I had a friend who helped step me through the process, I set them both up. There are also extra wired ports in back to plug in, say, a Roku unit or desk top computer. There's more, but that's what I use and am happy with the purchase. If you haven't used 5g before... be warned. It is fast.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Trott

customer_reviews.title: No DHCP, not a router
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased products from Netgear for years because they are so dependable. Sadly I bought this one for my mom who is in an assisted living facility. I struggled for days to get her connected to this device. After much language that would not be suitable for youth I discovered that this is a "bridge" and does not do dhcp. Dang. Totally hosed and beyond the date to return the stupid thing. I believe the description could be a bit more blunt but I did learn to be more observant.
customer_reviews.author: Bahloo

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this access point to work with my ISP supplied DSLmodem/router combo. I had problems with the old router constantly dropping out of the wifi network. I suspected there were too many devices connected. With the new device, it has worked without network loss for a week now. Setup was easy and took a few minutes. The signal strength was about the same as the old router, but wifi seems faster.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Decent WiFi option for the home.
customer_reviews.text: Had a very old WiFi access point. I needed to upgrade. Purchased this one because of the appealing price point. Set up was very quick. Had some nice features for a home product. The signal is a bit limited, but does give me ample speed for accessing from home office at the other side of the house. Drops a few times, but not really a show stopper.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Almeida

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Intuitive AP
customer_reviews.text: The AP was very easy to install with the included instructions. I installed it on our second floor as several areas had dead spots. I now have complete coverage with consistent 100+Mbps speeds. I was also concerned if it would work with my 802.11AX router but there have been no issues so far. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Easy installation. Super stable.
customer_reviews.text: I was having issues with another access point, causing it to drop off. So done with that. Replaced it with this access point, and I am very happy with it. Easy installation, very stable. No issues, which is what one hopes for with a product like this. Very happy with the purchase. As is my family.
customer_reviews.author: randomdigits

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Access point I tried, the other one was an off-brand wireless receive and transmit type, and it never worked. This one works well. I have it mounted in the attic above my garage so that devices can be used there. I have all my passwords set the same and it is very easy to connect and use. Recommended,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great addition for a wifi dead-spot in my house
customer_reviews.text: This is great... My kids is happy... It was kind of bad since the original wifi hot spot was at one end of the house and the other side was a dead-zone. I ran CAT-6 cable up through the attic and added this to the other end of the house. It works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Da Ewok

customer_reviews.title: Great little AP for adding coverage to home or small office.
customer_reviews.text: This little AP is great if you use it for what it's meant to be used for. It's an AP, not a router. Setup is simple, figure out the IP that your main router hands via that router's config page, point your browser to that IP, and configure. No muss, no fuss. The menu is a little old-looking, but it's simple. configure the name, AP info, hit submit, and you're done. Took less than 5 minutes to set it up, and does exactly what it says it will the the speeds that were advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Christine M. Chan

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem with weak wireless signal at far end of house
customer_reviews.text: We recently dropped our cable service so I needed to provide wifi to a TV with Roku in a bedroom at the far end of the house where the signal wasn't very good. There is wired ethernet in my office which is near the bedroom so I was able to install this access point in that room. Setup wasn't too bad. I changed the default password and named the SSID the same as the one on the router at the other end of the house. Working great so far.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Throw their instructions away and just call tech support
customer_reviews.text: The device appears to work fine, but configuration was a PITA. The included or downloadable instructions were worthless. I'm fairly tech savvy and have successfully set up and configured a few home networks. I ended up having to call their tech support which got me on track, but took 15 minutes to register and get connected. Adding an AP, should be plug-and-play but this requires finding the devices assigned IP address, which is NOT the one listed in the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H. Hogue

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: When it worked the signal was strong and no noticable lag. Problem we kept having was it would just stop working maybe a couple times a week. The wifi would just stop working and I couldn't connect to it over LAN. I'd have to unplug power and reboot to get it working again.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Literally impossible to setup
customer_reviews.text: It is impossible to setup this product. First the instructions they send with it are so obviously wrong. They skip the step where you connect to the device. I found updated instructions online where they include this step, but they are still not clear. Then the setup of the device directs you to aplogin.net, but this domain has expired or is no longer configured, which makes this device worthless. I would not only not buy this device again, I would never but another Netgear device based on this experience.
customer_reviews.author: John A

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up. Strong signal.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a piece of cake, and the signal actually is available all through my house. I positioned the access point in my basement because the grandkids use their devices down there sometimes. Since it's only needed a couple times a week, I showed the grandkids how to turn it on when they need it. It certainly solved my problems. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio user

customer_reviews.title: A good access point.  Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine access point. It probably deserves five stars. I had a lot of problems with dropped connections, which turned out to be the upstream router, and not this unit. Please make sure that your upstream router is solid before installing this unit. I suppose the only justification for not giving this unit five stars is that it should have given diagnostics about it having problems with the upstream router. AC speeds are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars I probably would. Directions are useless! The “admin site” to set up the access point is “under construction” so in other words non-existent. Don’t waste your time with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Borer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to connect but easy to setup once connected to the network.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Only issue mentioned by other reviewers is the unit comes set with a static IP address that requires a computer to be set to the same range to do the initial setup. Most other products have a dynamic IP address that allows connection into an existing network without the hassle of finding a spare computer and setting the IP connection to static in the correct IP range to communicate with the AP. Other than that, it is not difficult to setup and use.
customer_reviews.author: crginc

customer_reviews.title: Netgear always works well
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. Using as an acces point for a 5ghz and 2.4 ghz in our home. Strong signal for both and really boosted the connection speed for our old laptop on the 2.4 ghz band. Our laptop is far away from the router. Putting in this AC closer to the laptop increased its download speed from 9mbps to over 30mbps. I have always had good luck with Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just Horrible
customer_reviews.text: After I wasted an hour trying to configure this garbage, I gave up. I generally have no problem installing routers, but this was impossible. Slow, cryptic instructions, useless support. It deserves negative stars for wasting my time. Unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Very Recommeded
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these wireless access points. I had to jump through a few uncomfortable hoops to configure it, like changing my desktop computer's IP address, but once configured, these have worked flawlessly. I'm getting about 80mbps download speeds for WiFi, which is the best I've gotten to date. These aren't too expensive, in the $50-$60 range, and really improve my network performance. I took off a star for the difficulty in configuration. Other than that, these would be 5-stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jon V.

customer_reviews.title: Worst experience
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this AP last month and have had a tech support case open with Netgear support after the first week. Whether it be the AP dropping internet or WIfi just dropping. Tech Support has been no help. I continue to drop and reconnect to the AP (seen in the logs that were provided to support) and last night my Roku dropped and could not even see the 5ghz ssid and wouldnt connect to the 2.5ghz, while I was connected on my phone in the same room. Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Jl44

customer_reviews.title: Easy and quick to setup
customer_reviews.text: I ran a cable to an out building in order to get wifi there. Essentially, I hooked one end to the router and the other to this. It came right up and connected first try. My only gripe is that the password is in microscopic text.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalTech

customer_reviews.title: I bought two and these ar great!
customer_reviews.text: 1. Read the directions and this will work for you. Had them up for almost a year in conjunction with N7000. Couldn't be happier. Dual band is the "cat's meow" and it changed my house for the better!
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. But to set it up, you need some understanding of how IP addresses work. This access point's IP is 192.168.2.xxx. Most routers and home computers are in the 192.168.1.xxx range. So, to access this product with your computer, you've got to get your machine in the same IP range. Once you set it up, you can change it's IP to the 292.168.1.xxx range, and all will be fine. So far, very strong WiFi radio with solid connection. Deal!
customer_reviews.author: Dapipes2

customer_reviews.title: Nice wireless ac access point for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Setup was easy, and works seamlessly as an access point and as a switch. I have three of these access points setup on different floors - the connection transfers transparently from one access point to another.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Worked the best of all units I tried
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a unit to hook up to an access point to extend the router signal. This was easy to set up and provided a signal as strong as the origin point. It was very easy to install and setup.
customer_reviews.author: Jerryl

customer_reviews.title: Really bad shipping/Might not even be new, Box was opened
customer_reviews.text: I do not appreciate the fact that the package was opened and does not seem brand new. I paid for a new product and the retail box was literally open in the shipping container.I feel like they could have done a better job one protecting it and two at least making sure the box was sealed somehow so stuff couldn't fall out or get stolen. I hope the product works and is actually new as this has been purchased for a small business and they will be relying on its install this week
customer_reviews.author: Glitchbusters PC Repair

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Product works as advertised. Ran 100' of ethernet from my house to garage, and put the access point in the garage. Internet and signal works great. I'm able to play games online, no extra lag or problems. On the initial setup you have to go to the access point website and put a username and password. This website would not work for me, I wasted about a half hour trying to get it to work before trying the " unplug it and plug it back in" method. That worked and I felt like an idiot. Besides that it has been a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Adam A

customer_reviews.title: Netgear Dual Band Wireless Access Point
customer_reviews.text: Works really well but as reported by others it definitely was kind of quirky getting it set up. I am an IT guy so if I think this then most of you probably will too....now as far as the way it works once set up is great. I have separated my WiFi traffic by creating two SSIDs, one band for my "B-G-N" devices and one for my "AC" capable devices. If it wasn't for the quirkiness of the setup which I had to go thru a couple of times to get the thing configured exactly the way I wanted I would have given it 5 stars as now that its set up it has really improved my home WiFi experience
customer_reviews.author: JamesC

customer_reviews.title: Just buy a nighthawk for 50.00 more!
customer_reviews.text: This Acess Point is to say the least trash. I used it for a month and returned for a nighthawk and have been happy with the better model. Don't be tempted by the cheap price cause you do get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Sarg8908

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and good way to boost wireless internet signal.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to boost my wifi signal in my upstairs. It definitely did that. Most of the time I now get 250 mbps x 20 mbps on a 400x20 coax connection (tested on my galaxy s10). No complaints there as wifi is so unreliable. My Samsung smart tv connection was awful and I thought an Ethernet connection to the AP would help. I ended up buying a Roku and that did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating and poor
customer_reviews.text: Can't get to configuring it. No solution posted online helps and I have to stick to using the default network. On the plus side it is simply plug and use.
customer_reviews.author: Vihar

customer_reviews.title: fussy, but good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this access point as a replacement of one that died. The last one I plugged in and two minutes later it had set up automatically. This one was not quite so easy. In fact, I had to call technical support to get it to work. Once it was set up it was fast and worked very well. So I am happy with the unit now that it is set up but the set up was not all that easy.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Buratovich

customer_reviews.title: Unit good; setup instructions terrible
customer_reviews.text: The device works well thanks to a very helpful Netgeat support person who helped me get it set up. I have set up 5 or 6 routers before without a problem, but the setup instructions were incomprehensible, and I gave up after spending 3 hours trying and retrying. Netgear needs to hire someone with limited technical knowledge to write its setup instructions. I also found their Youtube demonstration equally incomprehensible. But, the unit itself works well.
customer_reviews.author: RJS

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing is great. For only $40, no more dead wifi zone! Easy to set up. Little bit of configuring, but once it's up, just match the SSID and password to your home network and you're good to go! I wish I had known about these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Good Access Point
customer_reviews.text: This access point works well. I put it in my Pole Building and the coverage was excellent across the 40x80 Pole Building. Just as fast as my internet in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Bowslayer

customer_reviews.title: Never buy this product (if it can be rated less than 1 star I would)
customer_reviews.text: This is portrayed as a good solution that is relatively straight forward to set up. It is horrible. The instructions do not work, and the URL listed in the setup instructions by Netgear brings you to a spam site. Horrible. Do not buy this product unless you are a very technical person with network admin. You need to configure this device and configure your services provider's device to allow the access point to work - per the Netgear technical support staff (after 3 transfers and close to 2 hours).
customer_reviews.author: Ds

customer_reviews.title: Problem Solved
customer_reviews.text: I needed my wifi down at the other end of my house and this access point was easy to set up and worked the first time I tried it. The hard part was running a cat 6 cable all the way in the basement, but with a cheap crimp tool and a $10 line tester I was confident that I didn't make a mistake. I studied all the review comments re set up and went to the Netgear site but as near as I can tell no other settings needed to be changed accept the password. Great product and now no more data overages on my cell plan.
customer_reviews.author: Phil B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fix for slow WiFi in brick ranch
customer_reviews.text: Was extremely easy to install and now have full WiFi strength on the other side of my house. I was having slow WiFi do to the brick construction of my home, this access point and Dan Ethernet cable solves that in 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks Jewett

customer_reviews.title: Fast WiFi Router with Strong Signal
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the same router for several years now with no problems. AC1200 is not the fastest router around today, but the price is right for what you get. I work from home with streaming quotes, VPNs into the office, and streaming TV all day long and I never have any issues with speed. And I get signal all over the house and even when I'm 100 away from the house outside on my cell phone. Not bad for the price. I've been using NetGear networking products for quite a while, with no real complaints to speak of, and I'm an IT professional.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H

customer_reviews.title: AT&T + iPhone Problems no more!
customer_reviews.text: After extensive research, I realized that a firmware update to my AT&T Fiber Router causes it to "Bandsteer" and slow down my wifi connection on my iPhones. I bought this access point, connected my router and problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: The FED Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Be careful if you order a refurbished/ used item
customer_reviews.text: After fighting with this thing for two days, I got hold of Netgear. Found out I bought a refurbished item unknowingly. If the previous owner of the product registered it with Netgear, you will not be able to register it yourself, making the item utterly useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Black

customer_reviews.title: Great WAP
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to cover my multi-family residence. They work wonderfully. The only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars is that the configuration interface could be a tad better. Don't get me wrong. Its pretty good, it just could be better
customer_reviews.author: Santa Cruz Kid

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for 8 months, company sent new one
customer_reviews.text: Update: the company sent us a new one for cost of shipping. The wireless worked great for a bit. I have owned it for 8 months and now can't get the wireless to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: iPhone Insight App password maze
customer_reviews.text: The app doesn't work right on the iPhone. There are three passwords: The company's management interface, the bridge's password, and when the iPhone detects a web page asking for a password, it brings up it's own window for you to enter a password, but it doesn't seem to use it? I couldn't get through the maze in the time I had.
customer_reviews.author: Rver

customer_reviews.title: Old school range extender with an access point.
customer_reviews.text: Dual radios allow you to use 2.4ghz and 5ghz bands at the same time. Gigabit hardwired ethernet for connection to your network allows maximum data transfer speeds between the access point and your router.
customer_reviews.author: T.J. Turgeon

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Complete garbage. The WiFi disconnects, is slow, and has the incorrect password bug. Total waste of money. Buy a different brand. I’ve tried TWO netgears, no good. Asus is fine. Get that.
customer_reviews.author: J. Seitz

customer_reviews.title: No bueno
customer_reviews.text: Not so easy to setup...directions were useless, ended up findng diections online. Would not by again. Might even return since when i change the passwords fo each wifi one doesnt change thn i need to start over and reset the access point.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: 2.4ghz band failed after a month of flawless operation; power cycle corrected it temporarily
customer_reviews.text: A lot of reviewers complained about complicated setup. I didn’t find it troublesome at all and I like the simplicity of the device. It’s just what I needed. When it worked, it was great. Unfortunately after a month of flawless operation the 2.4ghz band failed and the high band began to operate rather slowly. A power cycle corrected both problems ‘for now’. Returning it with 2 days to go on my return window and ordered another unit. I hope it works better or I will not try this product again.
customer_reviews.author: anon buyer

customer_reviews.title: Fast wifi to a remote area
customer_reviews.text: The access point solved the problem of weak wifi in the remote area of the house. I had a wired ethernet connection to that area from my modem but wanted access for wifi devices as well. Installation was quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Marc C Webb

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for about 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This wireless AP was purchased with the intent of connecting a Roku 3 to it using the 5ghz band so it wouldn't compete with the microwave and other devices on the 2.8GHz channel. It worked great for about 2 weeks, then wouldn't allow the Roku to connect. I could see the network on the Roku settings page, just couldn't connect. Verified this with another Roku. Could see the wireless networks, just not connect to them. I upgraded to the latest firmware with no improvement. In summary, works well as an AP, but won't allow Roku devices to connect.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Tabasz

customer_reviews.title: Not happy at all!
customer_reviews.text: First off, the instructions to get it set up did not work. You are supposed to connect to it via wifi and then browse to an address to set it up. I could not get this to work with 2 PCs. I finally googled and found an IP address to use to connect with a cable. This worked OK and the setup was fine. Fast forward 4 months. Wifi kept getting spotty. I would be connected, but no internet. I tried to re-set the AP and tried to re-set it up. I cam across the same issue mentioned above, but this time, I could not even use the IP address/cable method. The thing is now a brick and unusable.
customer_reviews.author: David Cribbs

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup but lack of performance
customer_reviews.text: The setup was pretty easy.however it didn't get the speed I expected. I'm getting at least 350mbps on my cell phone. Use this to connect my PS4 thru 5ghz wifi, it only gives around 60mbps. Not quite close to what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L.

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought a 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: This AP has great signal strength and easy to install and configure. Always had good success with Netgear wifi extenders and I'm sure this Netgear AP will not be the exception.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Mangold

customer_reviews.title: A good network extender
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device to extend WiFi coverage to a corner of the house that had a wired Ethernet connection but a poor signal from the modem/router that's located where the cable comes into the house. It was easy to install and set up and has worked flawlessly extending the existing SSID across the house.
customer_reviews.author: GregT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device - works exactly as it claims
customer_reviews.text: Awesome device - works exactly as it claims! If you can follow directions you can set this up with no problem. Bought this to upgrade the embedded access point in an AT&T U-verse router which is limited to 54 Mbps on wireless B and G only. Now the whole house has smokin-hot N at 300 Mbps on 2.4 GHz and the newer faster AC standard at 867 Mbps on 5 GHz. iPhones and newer laptops connect to the fast AC with no problem. Remember to enable wireless security when you set it up as this is turned off by default.
customer_reviews.author: Bri Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not a router!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a router. This is what is called an access point and we will be returning. False advertisement and a waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: jtruman

customer_reviews.title: A couple problems
customer_reviews.text: After about one month of operation the 2.4 GHz SSID went away. Attempting to reset the device through the 5 GHz connection I discovered there is no way to do so in the web interface. Someone in their community forum asked for that to be added in 2018 so don’t count on it happening. For the stability issue and the lack of reset ability I am downgrading my review to three stars
customer_reviews.author: Blair42

product_meta.title: NETGEAR AC1200 Dual Band Wireless Access Point (WAC104)
product_meta.description: Capacity:AC1200 Dual-Band APThe NETGEAR WAC104 is a dual band 802.11ac wireless access point for the small business, coffee shop or dental office looking for low maintenance, superior WiFi that is easy on the IT budget. The no-frills WAC104 features external antennas that provide a far reaching, rock solid WiFi signal and transfers data at speeds up to 1.2Gbps. Adding more value, the WAC104 is conveniently equipped with four (4) Gigabit Ethernet ports to further extend the wired network and comes with a segment leading 3-year hardware warranty and lifetime chat support. WAC104 – Fast, reliable WiFi that just works. Backward compatible to allow legacy devices to connect at their fastest speed. Powerful 880MHz processor.
feature_bullets: Fast dual band 802.11ac WiFi at a combined aggregate speed of 1.2 Gbps (300Mbps at 2.4 GHz and 867Mbps at 5 GHz)
Factory tuned external antennas provide superior signal and far reaching WiFi coverage
Advanced Security & Flexible Wireless Configuration - access point, and WDS point-to-point / point-to-multipoint wireless bridge mode.Memory:128MB NAND flash and 128MB DDR3 RAM
Works with all N150, N300, N600 and AC devices. IPV6 support for improved performance
Easy to setup and configure with WiFi Protected System (WPS) button for easy one-touch client connectivity
Four (4) built-in Gigabit Ethernet ports to connect to PC, laptops, and other wired devices

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,043 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #16 in Computer Networking Wireless Access Points
